title: Carousel Wrapping
custom_preconds:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/WBD-1522
Apps Loaded
User lands on a “small” sized carousel with more videos than can appear on the screen (>5) || OR User lands on “large” feature carousel with more videos than can appear on the screen (>3)
custom_steps:
When the user lands on the first item (far left item)
Then the user cannot scroll left from the first item
When the user tries to scrolls right
Then the user can scrolls through the carousel
When they reach the last item in the carousel (last new video), it is followed by the first video in the carousel
Then the user can continue to scroll right through the entire carousel repeated (as many times as they want)
When the user is mid scroll and tries to scroll left
Then the user should be able to scroll left
When the user scrolls through the carousel so that the first item comes back again and they scroll past it
Then the user can’t scroll left past the first item in the carousel
When the user scrolls left and the user reaches the first video in the carousel
Then the user cannot scroll left any further
And left button clicks do nothing

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify if the network disrupted then the other device should play the asset.
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the MLB App from Microsoft store.
2. User should Login with the valid credentials
3. Ensure that they are 5 devices logged in with the same account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. User clicks Menu button on the Remote to invoke the Left Menu
3. Navigate and select the Scores/Videos/Home View option
4. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
5. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4(No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
6. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
7. Disconnect the WIFI in one of the devices playing asset.
custom_expected: If the user's 5th device is getting the concurrency error message when playing 4 other devices and if one of the playing device's network is disrupted, THEN the device having the error message should be able to play the stream.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays -> Happy path
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the MLB App from Microsoft store.
2. User should Login with the valid credentials
3. Ensure that they are 5 devices logged in with the same account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. User clicks Menu button on the Remote to invoke the Left Menu
3. Navigate and select the Scores/Videos/Home View option
4. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
5. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
6. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
custom_expected:
WHEN the user plays the asset in all the 5 devices then in 4 devices the user should able to stream the asset with no issues. 
But for the 5th device the user should see the concurrency error message.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays after relaunching the App
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the MLB App from Microsoft store.
2. User should Login with the valid credentials
3. Ensure that they are 5 devices logged in with the same account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. User clicks Menu button on the Remote to invoke the Left Menu
3. Navigate and select the Scores/Videos/Home View option
4. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
5. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4(No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
6. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
7. Exit stream on 5th device (that had seen the concurrency error).
8. Wait a little over 2 minutes. Re-launch stream on 5th device.
custom_expected: WHEN the user Re-launches stream on 5th device, then user should see the concurrency error message again.

title: Authenticated-> AtBat Purchase & link to mlb.com account in Connected devices to watch in-season content
custom_preconds: Given a user has AtBat installed
custom_steps:
User launches AtBat, logins with the same account in Samsung TV and tests each of the below scenarios with fresh accounts:

1. User completes purchase on first launch of app. 
And user chooses to link to a MLB account
And user logs in with existing MLB account
Then the user should see a message informing them that their accounts have been linked

2. User completes purchase on first launch of app
And user chooses to link to a MLB account
And user registers new account
Then the user should see a message informing them that their accounts have been linked

3. User completes purchase and tries to link by registering MLB account that already exists. 
User should see appropriate error message indicating that their account already exists

4. When user attempts to log in on a ROKU device with an account that has been linked to a purchase
Then the user should be able to log in and unlock Full At Bat features
And the user should not be able to access MLB.TV streams unless they purchase or sign in with MLB.TV account

5. When the user completes a purchase of At Bat
And the user chooses to link to a MLB account that has MLB.TV entitlement 
Then the user should see a message informing them that their accounts have been linked
And the user should be able to access Full At Bat features
And the user should be able to access MLB.TV streams

6. When the user is not logged in with any account
And they try to access a Full At Bat feature
And they purchase AtBat
And the user chooses to link to an existing MLB account that has no entitlements
Then the user should see a message indicating that their accounts have been linked
custom_expected: Each of the above scenarios should pass.

1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
2. User should Login with the valid account
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option

WHEN the user selects Homepage game.
WHEN the user selects Featured game
custom_expected:
THEN user should see 
* Live: Has a ‘Watch Live’ button if available and entitled. ‘Listen live’ if audio only.
* Archived game: Has a ‘Watch Recap’ and ‘Watch Full Game’ button
* Free game of the day flag
* Blacked out game / audio only - with appropriate flags

Note: Note that the Recap and Archive is often not available until 30 - 90 mins after the game. The button should not display while the recap/ game is not available. We need to check the end game milestone to know if the game has ended and gone to slate.
